snippet: The American man left Virginia to fight for the Islamic State and was caught near the northern city of Sinjar, Kurdish and U.S. officials said.
abstract: American Mohamad Jamal Khweis, who claims to have fought alongside Islamic State in Iraq, surrenders to Kurdish soldiers in Sulaimaniya.

byline.original: By KAMIL KAKOL and NICHOLAS FANDOS
byline.contributor: Kamil Kakol reported from Sulaimaniya, and Nicholas Fandos from Alexandria, Va. Reporting was contributed by Tim Arango from Istanbul; Rukmini Callimachi and Karen Yourish from New York; Sewell Chan from London; and Eric Schmitt and Matt Apuzzo from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The American man left Virginia to fight for the Islamic State and was caught near the northern city of Sinjar, Kurdish and U.S. officials said.

headline.main: Amid ISIS Battles, American Surrenders in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Amid ISIS Battles, American Surrenders in Iraq

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
